verses.verse: (Job 11:2; (Prov. 18:21); Eccl. 5:3) In the multitude of words sin is not lacking, But (Prov. 17:27; (James 1:19; 3:2)) he who restrains his lips is wise.
The tongue of the righteous is choice silver; The heart of the wicked is worth little.
The lips of the righteous feed many, But fools die for lack of wisdom.
(Gen. 24:35; 26:12; Deut. 8:18; Ps. 37:22; Prov. 8:21) The blessing of the LORD makes one rich, And He adds no sorrow with it.
(Prov. 2:14; 15:21) To do evil is like sport to a fool, But a man of understanding has wisdom.
(Job 15:21; Prov. 1:27; Is. 66:4) The fear of the wicked will come upon him, And (Ps. 145:19; Prov. 15:8; Matt. 5:6; (1 John 5:14, 15)) the desire of the righteous will be granted.
When the whirlwind passes by, (Ps. 37:9, 10) the wicked is no more, But (Ps. 15:5; Prov. 12:3; Matt. 7:24, 25) the righteous has an everlasting foundation.
As vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes, So is the lazy man to those who send him.
(Prov. 9:11) The fear of the LORD prolongs days, But (Job 15:32) the years of the wicked will be shortened.
The hope of the righteous will be gladness, But the (Job 8:13) expectation of the wicked will perish.
The way of the LORD is strength for the upright, But (Ps. 1:6) destruction will come to the workers of iniquity.
(Ps. 37:22; Prov. 2:21) The righteous will never be removed, But the wicked will not inhabit the earth.
(Ps. 37:30; Prov. 10:13) The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom, But the perverse tongue will be cut out.
The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable, But the mouth of the wicked what is perverse.
(Lev. 19:35, 36; Deut. 25:13-16; Prov. 20:10, 23; Mic. 6:11) Dishonest scales are an abomination to the LORD, But a just weight is His delight.
When pride comes, then comes (Prov. 16:18; 18:12; 29:23) shame; But with the humble is wisdom.
The integrity of the upright will guide (Prov. 13:6) them, But the perversity of the unfaithful will destroy them.
(Prov. 10:2; Ezek. 7:19; Zeph. 1:18) Riches do not profit in the day of wrath, But (Gen. 7:1) righteousness delivers from death.
The righteousness of the blameless will direct his way aright, But the wicked will fall by his own (Prov. 5:22) wickedness.
The righteousness of the upright will deliver them, But the unfaithful will be caught by their lust.
When a wicked man dies, his expectation will (Prov. 10:28) perish, And the hope of the unjust perishes.
(Prov. 21:18) The righteous is delivered from trouble, And it comes to the wicked instead.
The hypocrite with his mouth destroys his neighbor, But through knowledge the righteous will be delivered.
(Prov. 28:12) When it goes well with the righteous, the city rejoices; And when the wicked perish, there is jubilation.
By the blessing of the upright the city is (Prov. 14:34) exalted, But it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.
He who is devoid of wisdom despises his neighbor, But a man of understanding holds his peace.
(Lev. 19:16; Prov. 20:19; 1 Tim. 5:13) A talebearer reveals secrets, But he who is of a faithful spirit (Prov. 19:11) conceals a matter.
(1 Kin. 12:1) Where there is no counsel, the people fall; But in the multitude of counselors there is safety.
He who is (Prov. 6:1, 2) surety for a stranger will suffer, But one who hates being surety is secure.
A gracious woman retains honor, But ruthless men retain riches.
((Matt. 5:7; 25:34-36)) The merciful man does good for his own soul, But he who is cruel troubles his own flesh.
